p: This antioxidant activity would also inhibit essential enzymes responsible to the endogenous production of reactive oxygen species (ROS) during the metabolism of arachidonic acid, such as nitric oxide synthases (NOSs), cytochrome P450 (CP450), NADPH oxidase (NOX), xanthine oxidase (XO) lipoxygenase (LO), cyclooxygenases (COXs) and myeloperoxidase (MP) [ 68, 69]. The expression of these enzymes is stimulated in the inflammatory conditions, and therefore, inhibition of these enzymes will stop ROS production that leads to reduce oxidative stress and then an anti-inflammatory effect [ 68, 69]. Since mediators of inflammation play crucial roles in various diseases (e.g., cancer and obesity) [ 70, 71], SBH could also rely on these mechanisms of action in modulating the inflammatory-associated diseases.
